title: Panificio Navona & Bethel Cycle Summer Crit Series
Panificio Navona & Bethel Cycle Summer Time Trial
Wrath of the Boneyard
course: Multiple laps of natural rocky trails.
notes: Classes: USA Cycling PRO, CAT 1, CAT 1 Singlepeed, CAT 2, Singlespeed Open, CAT 3.  All PRO, CAT 1 racers MUST have an annual USA Cycling license.  One day memberships available for CAT 2 and #.
directions:
From the north: I-91 South to Exit 20. Left onto Middle St.. Right at stop sign onto Country Club Rd.  Straight for approx. 1.4 miles to right onto Stantack Rd. From the South: I-91 North to Exit 20. Left onto Country Club Rd. Straight through stop sign, then 1.4 miles to Stantack Rd. on right.  
GPS coordinates: N41 33 53.4 W72 44 54.6

title: Green & Gold Criterium
description: This is the race that was held in the 80s. It runs along the water
notes: Nice wide course. 4 corner . one pop- up hill
directions: New London , Near Ocean beach. Mitchell college.

title: 2012 Lime Rock Park Cycling Grand Prix
Winsted Woods MTB Cross Country Race presented by
description:
Winsted Woods presented by Bikers Edge
Root 66 Series Race #11
CT State Championship Event
course:
Course Description: The course is a challenging and technical 8 mile loop with 800 feet of elevation per
lap. Everything is extremely well marked – same as last year. There will be new sections to the course
this year. Above distances may change but you will be notified at the start the exact length of the course.
registration:
Pre registration is available at www.bikereg.com and is $25 – must be completed before 11:59PM, July 27th – afterwards there is an $8 late fee, same applies to day of registration. One Day licenses are
available for Cat 2 and Cat 3 only. Registration Opens at 8:00AM and closes 15 minutes prior to posted
start times.
notes:
Hot Food will be available all day, music and of course - bouncers for the kids. 
More information about the series is available at www.root66raceseries.com.
Notes: Payouts will be 1-5 if at least 20 entries or 1-3 if less then 20 entries.
The payouts will be up to half of the entry fees for Cat 1 and Pro Races.
No refunds. Day of registration please pay with cash so we can payout with cash. Thank you!
directions:
Directions:

From Rte 44 Head West through the Center of Winsted

Turn Right onto Spencer Street

Turn Right onto Hinsdale Ave

Turn Left onto Williams Ave

Go to the end of the street and bear Right onto Williams Ave to the parking lot

GPS: 200 Williams Ave, Winsted  CT  06098

 

Contact info:  Robert Carmen – 413-246-1856, email: rwcarmen@gmail.com

title: Ashford Metric Century+
description: This is a fund raising event to benefit the Ashford Recreation Department. All routes are fully supported and include the quiet and rolling hills of Ashford, Eastford and Woodstock.  Come out and enjoy the stunning fall foliage in classic New England.
course:
Date: Sunday, September 30th 2012 
Time: 100 mile 7:30am start
  65 mile 9:00am start
  25 mile 9:30am start
  10 mile 9:30am start
registration: Registration starts at 7:00am and ends at 9:30am.  100 miler\'s should be on the road by 7:30am, 62 milers by 9am and all other riders should be on the road by 9:45am.  Day of ride registration will be an additional $10 for each ride except the 10 miler ($30 for the 25 miler, $35 for the 62 miler, and $45 for the 100 miler), so register online to save a little money!
notes:
There will be one rest stop on the 25 mile ride and several rest stops on the 62 mile and 100 mile ride.  Rest stops will be stocked with snacks (gatorade, water, pbj\'s, baked goods, granola bars, m&m\'s, etc.) and will have a floor pump and basic repair tools.

Participants should ride with a tube, tire levers, pump, and patch kit in case of flat tires.   CPSC or US DOT approved helmets are required.
directions:
Directions:

Ride starts at Ashford Elementary School on Route 89 in Ashford, CT

Ashford Elementary School
440 Westford Rd.
Ashford, CT 06278

From the South and Willimantic:
From Willimantic take Route 195 north toward The University of Connecticut. In Mansfield Center turn right onto Route 89. Follow Route 89 north into Ashford. Cross Route 44. Ashford School is located on Route 89 2 miles north of the intersection with Route 44. 

From the West and Hartford:
Take I-84 East to Exit 69. Turn right onto Route 74. Follow Route 74 through Willington to Route 44 in Ashford. Turn left on Route 44 to the intersection of Route 89. Turn left on Route 89. The school is on the right 2 miles to the north. 

From the North and Massachusetts:
Take I-84 to Exit 72. Turn left on Route 89. Follow Route 89 (south) watching the signs because it turns twice. Ashford School is located on the left side of Route 89 about 6 miles from I-84. 

From the East and Rhode Island:
From the Rhode Island border take Route 101 west. It merges with Route 44 in Pomfret. Continue on Route 44 west until Route 89 in Ashford. Turn right on Route 89. Ashford school is located on the right about 2 miles north of Route 44

title: 2012 Markus Bohler Memorial Ride
description: 2012 Markus Bohler Memorial Ride. This is a non-competitive ride to commemorate the official ribbon cutting of the Markus Bohler Memorial in Bethel, CT.
course: Course is to be determined. There is a 2.5 hour allotment for riding.
registration: Registration is free. All fees are covered by the organizers.
notes: This is a self support type ride. There will be no support provided of any sort.
directions:
Please use for GPS purposes:
7 Francis J Clarke Circle
Bethel, CT 06801

title: Hop Brook Cyclocross
course: Open Field, Dirt Roads, Pavement, Climbs, 2 dismounts per lap. Each lap approx 1 mile loop
registration:
Registration:  
• Pre-Registration ONLY 
      (except K ids 12 & Under race which is free)
• Pre-register online at bikereg.com until
      Saturday  Nov. 17 at 3:00pm
• Or send standard release form with fee to: 
 Cycle Fitness 
612 Main Street
 Monroe CT 06770
1-800-240-BIKE
notes:
Race Rules & Information:
• All USA C ycling C yclocross rules apply
• USAC license required for all riders
• Annual license required for CT C hampionship 
medals
• One Day license available for $10
• One Day license holders may only race Cat 4/5
• Helmets must be worn at all times while on 
bike.
directions:
Hop Brook Lake, Middlebury CT
Take I-84 to Exit 17 to Route 63 (south). Follow 
Rt. 63 (south) until it intersects with Rt. 188. The 
park entrance of Hop Brook Lake is at the 
intersection of Rt. 63 and Rt. 188.
